Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: Me1_12
Reviews.Content: This was my worst experience ever. We were 4 friends renting a room for several days but we barely had room to move. The pull-out couch was so unconfortable and in general the place was extremely dirty. The also advertise for free breakfast but its only a toast and coffee is not even included.... Finally, our luggage got stolen on our last day in the locked luggage room (after we check out from the room) and the hotel did not do anything to compensate even though it was totally their responsabilities. So I really recommend you not going there to try to save a few dollars. Totally not worth it. I will never ever return back there.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: julie l
Reviews.Content: This hotel is filthy dirty and infested with bed bugs. Travelled there with a client and came home covered in welts and bites. I had to go to a clinic to also get checked for lice. Infested and needs to be reported to the health board. I would never recommend staying here even if you are on a budget... the streets are cleaner!

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: vaus
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many places in vancouver area,low budjet,medium ....This place is by far the best.very friendly front desk,nice breakfast included,sauna,jacuzi,inside outside pool,pool table,free internet at lobby,hifi...and best of all the price,thanks again

Reviews.Title: “if you like bed bugs and uncaring staff you'll love this place!”
Reviews.Author: GrannySharon
Reviews.Content: my brother had to stay here because of the closeness of the Cancer Clinic. If I had another choice that wasn't going to cost 4 or 5 times what was paid here I would have moved him in a heart beat. Not only was his room infested with bed bugs but the staff didn't want to help him with the expense of his laundry nor did they help him move all his stuff. I can't even say all the nasty comments etc. that the front desk staff made.

Reviews.Title: “Not grand, but decent, lots of value for your money”
Reviews.Author: WildRose155032
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights. The 1st night was not great - I'm extremely sensitive to smoke and although I had a non-smoking room, probably cigarette smoke from the balcony below gave me a very bad headache during the night. However early the next day when discussing this problem with the staff, they switched us to a different room on the 1st floor which had just been renovated and nobody had slept in yet. It was great. This room was sleek and beautiful and clean. The gardens, pool and jacuzzi are clean and enjoyable. The breakfasts and rooms are small, but the cost to your pocketbook is also small. I believe we received excellent value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly”
Reviews.Author: pokey45963
Reviews.Content: Though I must say that the staff were very friendly, except for the person on duty the first nite I arrived at 1 a.m. quite exhausted after a long trip, my biggest complaint would be the smell in the room. It was overpowering. It smelled like old old dirty socks and it was impossible to get rid of it, though I kept the doors to the balconies open at all times. The other complaint would be that the balconies were so dirty and old that it would be unhealthy to venture out there. The building itself is lovely, but it needs a lot of work.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place I have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Rohalo2
Reviews.Content: I only required a small place to sleep a few hours while my grandson was in Children's Hospital. The pull-out couch was so hard and uncomfortable, it was like sleeping on a thin foam on the ground while backpacking. There was no room to get into the so-called bed properly, one had to crawl over the pillows at one end, the rest of the bed was blocked against walls. The bed area was smaller than the smallest boat cabin I have ever slept in. The only wash basin was a bathroom type sink in the kitchen area. I didn't see any bedbugs though, and I didn't get bitten so I guess I should be happy about that. I only needed a place to sleep, but I was too too uncomfortable to sleep. I couldn't sit at the little sitting area, because the bed took up all the room. I did get a better sleep the next day in a chair at the hospital. That awful night cost $86.77.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: mario123456
Reviews.Content: This was the worst experince ever! My friend got bed bugs bites everywhere...they were huge and nasty! The hotel rejected a refund due to the welts on his body weren't big enough..although he had told the manager he saw the bed bug on the bed!!!!! Regardless.....bed bugs!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK if you are desperate”
Reviews.Author: PaulinVence
Reviews.Content: Reasonably clean, not far from downtown but for the rest I would try to avoid. Very basic accomodation indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Functional Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryHDiva
Reviews.Content: I must admit that reading some of the comments in here left me very hesitant to stay here. I generally stay at high end hotels so this sounded like quite the departure from my usual accommodation. However, my father had booked it for it's close proximity to the Vancouver General Hospital while my Mother was having surgery. This place falls under, you get what you pay for - nothing more nothing less. The rooms are indeed compact (think a tent trailer layout where the most is made of any available space). The rooms were older for sure but ours was clean. I had brought a scented candle to deal with the odors I had read about - absolutely not necessary as this was so not the case. The staff were helpful and gracious and met all of our requests with a smile. The restaurant downstairs was fine for the voucher breakfasts and I would encourage any visitor to try the Japanese menu - very authentic and very tasty. I think it is unfortunate that some people had such a different experience than we did but I would most certainly recommend this to anyone who needs accommodation close to VGH. If you are looking for luxury, you would do best to look elsewhere and pay the price for that.

Reviews.Title: “Not for travellers! Stay only if this is significantly cheaper than any other place!”
Reviews.Author: Georgeamazing
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this "hotel" for 2 weeks during my visit to Vancouver. Technically on business and needed to be close to VGH. Location: Approximately 30 minutes by taxi from the airport, this hotel is located adjacent to Vancouver General Hospital and is also adjacent to a quieter portion of West Broadway. Certainly, if you are a tourist that would like to see what Vancouver has to offer, this is not the location to do it at. Otherwise, if you are required to stay near VGH, this is one of the few strong points of the hotel. Hotel: The hotel itself on the outside appears more like an aged apartment building. The lobby is decent, and the I never encountered any problems with the staff although they can change their affect quickly with a minor complaint. The best part of the hotel was the restaurant downstairs. You do get free breakfast, but that is just a standard western breakfast that is average at best. The restaurant itself is an authentic Japanese restaurant run by Japanese people. The Japanese breakfast which you have to pay out of pocket for is excellent and the dinner menu is equally great with seasonal specials. Ate there at least half a dozen times and every meal was satisfactory. Not the best Vancouver has to offer but if you are too lazy to walk out to Broadway, this is a convenient and decent alternative. Amenities: I did not use many of the amenities available in this hotel. I will say though that there is a jacuzzi, gym and other stuff in the basement. Rooms are only cleaned weekly, so you are stuck retrieving your own towels from the basement and if you require a change of bedsheets, the onus is on you. There is free wireless internet in the lobby + 3 computers for general use. No internet in room period (either wireless or wired). The Room: I booked the cheapest room they had and it certainly showed. It was small. I have been in small rooms in Japan and abroad in Asia, but this is as small or even smaller than those rooms. The bed is actually pulled out from the couch and the sink to wash up is not in the washroom, but in the living area. Speaking of washroom, it stunk. Worst part of my stay was needing to shower or use the facilities and having to bear the smell which was reminiscent of aged public washrooms. There is also a TV in the room with basic cable. Small but operational. View was good from the balcony. In summary, this is not a place for tourists. If you are a tourist, avoid this hotel at all costs. There are cheaper B&B's that will be much more suitable. The only person I would recommend this hotel to is the individual who is on an immensely strict budget needing to be close to VGH AND requires a lengthy stay. If you satisfy all those requirements, then give this place a thought as it can save you a few bucks. Otherwise, Park Inn suites is just as convenient to VGH and for a minor price increase, you will avoid this place (which is always a bonus).

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever and this coming from a retired ramada assistant general manager”
Reviews.Author: jenswatt
Reviews.Content: We were referred to this hotel by vancouver general hospital on november 12 2010 because our father was undergoing emergency surgery after suffering from an anurism. We had planned on staying at hospital in shifts so only two of us were going to stay at hotel. We explained this to guest service agent at check in along with the general situation. Due to the circumstances we expected a little understanding and patience, instead we were greated with hostility and acusations. I asked for two sets of keys as my sister may have to meet me at hospital fast while our brother in law takes care of a few things. The gs agent accused us of lying and moved our room from a room with two queens to the smallest room with one bed. The room ended up getting used for three hours by sister and brother in law. Upon check out the gs agent very rudelly asked where the rest of where because he knows we had lied to him. We moved to parks in where they were understanding and cheeper. We registered for two weeks with two rooms. The shaughnessy room was very small and smelly. I slept ina waiting room at vancouver general where i was more confortable.

Reviews.Title: “What a bad Joke”
Reviews.Author: CMangnus
Reviews.Content: This place is Pathetic. I moved to this dump because I needed one more week in Vancouver. My mother was in intensive care at VGH and I was desperate for a place to guarantee me 7 more days. I laughed when I entered the room. At $135.00 per night it was a joke. No housekeeping what so ever. You have to take your own garbage out to the alley. You have to go to the basement if you want clean towels. The breakfast was equally marginal. Just leave this place to the back packers.

Reviews.Title: “This place has BEDBUGS”
Reviews.Author: spiritsister
Reviews.Content: This was a horrible place to stay....i was there all of 10 minutes, the service sucked, the room stunk and we found bedbugs crawling on the bed....the desk clerk offered us another room and when i stated we did not want another room as Bed bugs require fumigation, not cleaning - he walked away. NIHB places families with appointments at this nasty place. I'd rather sleep in my car than stay in a place like this.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the City”
Reviews.Author: homespunArmstrongBC
Reviews.Content: Great spot - helpful staff. Maximized storage in compact rooms. Loved the gardens, free mini-golf, free breakfast, pool, hot tub. We'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't wast your money!!”
Reviews.Author: あやめんこ
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the rate but it was really a wast of money.A big mistake! The room was pretty small and stinky!Not to mention their miserable breakfast... We were supposed to stay longer *a couple of weeks but decided to shorten our stay of course without any reimbursement... We just wanted to get out from there!!We moved to a hotel in DT. This hotel was really far from DT and the nearest bus stop was far away about at least 10min walk! We learned that there were no cheap hotel in Vancouver..If it is the case there should be the reason!I wonder why this hotel could still exist.Is this a miracle?? The staff were not at all helpful neither...I can't find any positive point for this hotel I regret... Just don't go!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Honest people, honest price”
Reviews.Author: AdrienRi
Reviews.Content: I stayed 30 days and it cost me close to $1000, including a dozen breakfasts. Pretty inexpensive for its location (20 min from downtown in bus, 10 min walk to any business you want). It is not a fancy place. The decoration sucks (the colors in the corridors were... let's say... amazing), the single rooms are pretty small (less than 200sq.ft I would say) and nothing is sparkling clean... well, that is what you can expect when you look for a cheap place with a good location! So my overall feeling about the Shaughnessy Village is that you get a decent room for a very decent price. It was quiet. I remember the manager had to kick several people out during my stay because they had apparently been messy/noisy, and it was their "second chance" from what I heard. Anyway, the crew is nice, professional. They just wanted me to have a nice stay as much as possible, and could answer all my questions when I needed help. You can have internet (through their network, which sucks and is expensive, or through an internet provider, I personally had "Telus" setup an account for my 30 days, it was pretty cheap) I hope this was helpful

Reviews.Title: “Pass this one up”
Reviews.Author: BadScene
Reviews.Content: It's at 1125 West 12th Avenue. Filthy, infested with bedbugs, smells bad, dangerously outdated and broken fitness equipment, billing mistakes, will not accept your luggage and cause it to be lost. You can find much better and cleaner accommodation in Vancouver. Evening staff is wonderful, but the daytime managers are crooks.

Reviews.Title: “fun and quirky at a great price. Recomended”
Reviews.Author: tallandrew
Reviews.Content: This hotel is kitted out in the style of an ocean liner. It has excellent views over downtown vancouver and gives an affordable and fun place to stay. There's lots to do such as a gym, inside and outside hot tub, mini golf and shuffle board (and most of these can be used at no extra charge). Downtown is walkable (about 45 mins) abd there are frequent buses and an underground car park. I'd stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Bad on so many levels”
Reviews.Author: dman123
Reviews.Content: The worst thing about this place is that you don't realize how much it sucks until you've stayed there a day or two. The amazing part is that it's usually almost full, and at the prices. 950 for a closet, and 1350 for a very mediocre 1 bedroom. Be ready for an extra $70 "maintenance fee" they mention just as they're about to give you your key. The facilities: The pool is outside and not heated. Great idea in a city like vancouver. It had a sheet of ice over it a few weeks back The hottub is very old and dingy, looks like it was built in the 70's. The "health club" is laughable. The equipment are antiques. The movie room is not a room you would want to watch a movie in. Basically, all the facilities or "features" they list on the site which sound great are all just so they can advertise them as features. None of them were ever being used and smelled like dingy rooms that were never used, probably because half of them are on the underground floor. The complimentary breakfasts are at the in-house restaurant, which is actually a Japanese restaurant. I love Japanese food, but they do not know how to cook western breakfasts. I fellow resident warned me not to eat the omlette. The pancakes tasted like water, and the ham and eggs had no flavor, with the ham actually being a spam like substance shaped like a piece of ham. I ate 2 meals and threw the rest of the coupons out. The worst part of my experience was the smell in the room, cleverly masked on the first day by air fresheners. After the first day the room starts to smell like an ashtray. I found this strange since they insited there was no smoking in the building. After the first night, smell the shirt you wore to bed. You will literally smell like an ashtray. Even worse, once you move out, everything you kept in the room that can hold an odour smells like old cigarettes, even clothes I put in cupboards and didn't wear. This is the honest truth, and I couldn't believe it. I usually take overly negative ratings with a grain of salt, they're often revenge posts. The internet has no shortage of smear campaigns. And this place isn't hell on earth, but it just plan sucks, all around. Every picture of the "features" you see on the site is a big disappointment in person, and none of the features that look like places to hang out (cupid gardens, movie room, outside dining, so called games rooms, etc), you will not want to spend any time in. And this entire building apart from the front desk area smells like ashtray. If I sound negative, I'm upset that they wouldn't refund my money after I tried to make an early exit. I pleaded that I felt duped into a room that smelled borderline the 1st day but horrible from then on. Yet I got the smug attitude of a management that is comfortable with their 80% occupancy rate, as they point to the fine print of the rental contract. I checked out before 2 weeks was up. I'm not overly picky, but this building is a huge disappointment, and probably only worth half of what they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Good affordable B&B in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: hull534
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this B&B four different times and each time was just the same. A good decent inexpensive place to stay in Vancouver, BC, Canada. Breakfast is included, and it's a good breakfast. The single rooms are tiny, but good enough for one person. The two-room suites are better for two people. I don't know how two people could fit into the small pull-out bed in the single room unless they are pretty small people!! The location is good, a quick walk down 4 blocks to the main road into town where there are many busses you can hop on for a quick ride to downtown Vancouver. I've stayed at more expensive hotels on Robson street, but all you get is a bigger room there. I don't know why people rate this place so low, it is a nice inexpensive B&B and doesn't pretend to be anything else but that. The views from the upper floors facing the city are great! There is a pool guests can use which is nice but it's not fully indoor and got kinda cold even in summer at night. I haven't used the hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place I have ever stayed in my entire life”
Reviews.Author: Lauralee885
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small and not very clean. If you have any kind of back pains or hip do not sleep on the so called bed, you will not be able to get out of it in the morning that is if you can sleep at all, I have had better night sleep in a tent on the ground. I have travelled quite a bit and have never stayed at a place where I said I would never stay again until now.

Reviews.Title: “Great transitional place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jgaVancouver
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 8 days while relocating to vancouver and once I upgraded to a larger room was quite comfortable. If I was just going to stay 1 or 2 nights the smaller room would have been ok. Staff at front desk and restaurant were friendly. My room faced the back and was extremely quiet and the bed was comfortable. The only irritating thing was that you have to purchase wireless from the restaurant and the signal is quite weak up in the rooms so you have to sit in the lobby or restaurant if you want to use your computer.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for-- NOT A BAD THING!”
Reviews.Author: mjgriffy
Reviews.Content: Sometimes when one says, "You get what you pay for" it has negative connotations. But in the case of Shaughnessy Village it is absolutely true-- with a positive spin. This hotel is ridiculously cheap in comparison to other hotels in Vancouver, yet it still provides a clean, safe, convenient, comfortable accommodations. Albeit, it comes with a dose of tiny rooms, dated kitschy decor, and service with sass. I have stayed in many high class and low brow hotels in Vancouver, and this hotel is definitely not high class. But, for the same money as the other low-brow hotels, Shaughnessy Village does NOT have a club thumping downstairs, bottles breaking outside, fists fighting in the streets, or hookers in the lobby. It is truly a cheap alternative for a good night's sleep. The rooms are indeed tiny. Best for only one or two persons who will sleep well and shower in the room. The hotel itself is well appointed with a small weight-room, swimming pool, jacuzzi, restaurant, and parking garage. Again, it comes with a hefty dose of quirky marine decor. But for this price, I don't care. If YOU want to spend twice as much for silly frills and shallow service, stay elsewhere. But if you want a good night's sleep at a really good price just outside the downtown core, this hotel is a good alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: pranab68
Reviews.Content: I ignored negetive reviews and I suffered. My small family stayed for 3 nights. It was booked one and a halfmonths in advance. At admission we were showed a family suite before checking in. It was unnecessary as no refund was possible if we reject the room. I have never seen such micro room before. The Suite comprised of a five and a half feet by six feet room ( having a double bed) and a adjacent four feet by six feet curved slice of a passage (converted to a room) having a sofa pullout . There were two balconies with beautiful view of the city but you cannot stand on balcony as each has a plastic table and two plastic chairs which fill up the space. A small child can perhaps squeeze in. The bathroom is a wonder. It is attached to the main room.`It had a semitransparent curtain and no doors'. I had to ask my child to go to the other room while I took the shower. You have to climb few steps to reach the bathtub (cum shower) and then jump down in a unusually deep bathtub. Heaven knows where they obtained such unusual bathtub from. You run a great risk of slipping and having and accident getting in and out of it. In fact, my child had a fall in bathtub. Fortunately it was not serious. It had a minifridge and a microwave but no plates, cups, spoons, tea or coffee bags and not even a water jug. Two slices of soaps (one each for bathroom and toilette) were given and no more, not even when requested, in three days. One toilette paper roll for three days. Nobody cleaned the room, made the beds during the entire stay. The pillows were flat, blankets thin and extra was not available on the evening we checked in. We had to carry these from maintenance to our room at 11th floor the next day as there was no room service to cut costs. The breakfast was limited to one toast cut into half plus cereal with half cup of milk (or omlette etc) and tea or coffee or fruit juice. You have to sign and countersign significant number of vouchers before breakfast was allowed. The front desk was unhelpful in even helping me with informations regarding travel in the city. The manager lady was clearly arrogant and hostile. Her answer to any complaint was that I am free to leave, of course without a refund, if I am not happy. The place is by no means cheap and to catch the nearest bus you have to walk half an hour. There are no shops nearby. Inspite of the shortcomings the place was almost full which made me curious. Most of the clients appeared immigrants and therefore with no prior knowledge of the place, poor in english expression and perhaps economically challenged. Only postive point about this place is the impressive tall building which might mislead a visitor standing outside it.

Reviews.Title: “Small”
Reviews.Author: jeanlim
Reviews.Content: As a location, it is not that convenient without a car. The most striking thing, however, is how small the room is. It is really tiny! The staff let you view the room before commiting and payment is per day. The toilets, though clean were very old and the room carpeting was damp. However, the room had a refridgerator, microwave and TV. There were, however, good facilities. There was a hot tub, swimming pool and small gym for common usage.

Reviews.Title: “old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It has been a few years since I have been there but I have stayed many times in the last 10 years. I agree with everything both good and bad in the other reviews. Most memorable is the elevator stench. I kind of felt like I was paying for the lobby/tv room which is more for long term guests I think. I did not mind the small rooms since I did not stay in the room much but if you are planning to spend alot of time in the room I would look elsewhere. Safeway is not that far. I believe just a 10 minute walk east on 12th. Check in front desk procedures are quaint and a bit slow if many people in line.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Blessing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a busy street but is reasonably quiet through the night. If you are there with a car, everything is a convenient drive in any direction. Public transit is about three blocks away. The front desk staff is cheerful and helpful. They gave me extra towels when I asked. They also provided an extra set of room keys on request. (There were two of us staying and we each had separate daytime appointments.) Parking is an extra cost. I think it cheeky of any hotel, even a cheap one, to ask a parking fee. The elevator often had the scent of cigarettes and alcohol. The room is extremely small. I knocked my knees a few times getting in, out of, and around the bed even though I am quite small myself. The room is tidy but apparently not dusted on a regular basis and I wondered if it had been vacumed recently. Amenities are reasonable: Anyone serious about their daily workout will laugh at the weight room, but it serves the purpose. Sauna Two jacuzzis - one in the basement, one outside with the swimming pool. --- The change room in the basement is a nicer place to have your daily shower than the bathroom in your own room. The grounds are impeccably groomed and enjoyable on a nice day. The hotel restaurant is convenient but only open from 7:00 a.m. till 1:00 p.m. then open again later in the day for supper. I thought breakfast was greasier than it needed to be. My husband thought it was *okay*.

Reviews.Title: “More like an RV atmosphere, but such a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is above average in most areas but the ones that you normally think of relating to a hotel. The standard rooms are tiny and a little bizarre, the restaraunt is poor but getting better. The deluxe room is a much better bet for two. But the grounds are pretty and you don't normally see an urban hotel that has a free mini golf course. We have stayed there many times and the neighborhood is fantastic. Near Granville Island, antique stores, theatre, great restaraunts and very convenient to downtown on public transportation. If you are looking for a resort hotel or an average sized room, move on. But if you can put up with some oddness you will find some fun amenities and a can't be beat location.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad as reported”
Reviews.Author: Mikey_Vienna
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 6 nights at the Shaughnessy Village Bed and Breakfast, and I admit that I liked it. Reception staff has always been very polite to me. They have a strange checkin procedure, you may visit your room first, and thereafter you need to go back down to complete the check-in. As a guest I may expect a 'finished' room, and that all rooms are moreless equal. So why that effort? My room was expectedly small, but featured a bathroom with a tube, a balcony, a fully furnished kitchen and a wallbed (bed and couch in one). I don't know why people complain about the size, it's advertised as B&B, and they even state the size of the rooms. As a guest paying daily rates, you are entitled to breakfast vouchers, which can be redeemed at the 12th Avenue restaurant, which is located in the house. You may choose between different types of omlettes and one cup of coffee. It's not much, but it is good to cover the first hunger in the morning. Shaughnessy also offers a swimming pool, a jacuzzi, a nicely decorated garden and health club, which I didn't use. Location is basically good, but you have to walk at least three blocks to reach a bus stop (Broadway). Unfortunately there is no good supermarket available. Considering that the Shaughnessy is a B&B, it impressed me deeply. I only paid $65, but I had all the amenties mentioned, even a bath tube in my private bathroom. That's a lot in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!! Don't stay there!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Far too expensive, too smelly, too many drunk smelly old men yuk yuk yuk. There are still smoking rooms and the ventilation is so poor that it blows into your room too! Rooms are sooooooo small it's unbearable, not sound proof either. Some rooms have some cooking facilities however there is no cutlery, crockery or pots and pans provided! Nothing at all luxurious about it they should be sued for false advertising!! The decor is very dated and bad to start with, the health club is a few crappy old machines cramped into a little room, as for the Cybercafe it's one old computer in the corner of the restaurant which doesn't always work and costs $2.30 for 15mins!!!!! There are extra costs left right and centre for the laundry, parking, housekeeping etc etc. Most the staff were helpful, it's in a convenient location and it was clean thank goodness. Overall it comes highly unrecommended especially for a lengthy stay (more than one night that is!).

Reviews.Title: “cruise ship or prison?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree with another persons comments that the rooms are so small you have to leave the room just to change your mind. It's 162 square feet of confinement! The monthly rate advertized is so attractive you move in only to find it applies only for a minumum 6 month stay...... then it's more than double. It's cheaper to rent an unfurnished place and buy new furniture! But it is clean though and the amenities are good. One or two nights is more than plenty.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, but a good buy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the B & B at Shaugnessy Village before and aften an Alaskan Cruise. The grounds are lovely and the rooms are clean, each with a tiny balcony. The standard room is very narrow, like an RV, with a microwave, fridge, a small dinette and fold down double bed. Was fine for one night. After the cruise we stayed for 3 nights in a two room suite. We liked this one much better with the full size bed in a separate bedroom. The clientele seem to be a mix of senior citizens (who live there I think), students, and business travelers. Staff are friendly for the most part. The breakfast voucers are a nice addition. We'd probably stay there again if we couldn't get anything across the bridge right in the downtown area. The B&B is about a $10 (American) cab ride to the cruise terminal, about $20 to the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Like a prison, only you get to pay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: S.V. is a good place to stay for one or two nights, but if you are planning to stay for a month or more, it's not really worth it. If you are under 30, the Strata Complex (Not a hotel, not condominiums, not apartments) management treat you like a criminal. If something goes wrong in the building, and you're under 30, they confront you as if you were the perpetrator. Also, they advertise luxurious rooms (Like on a cruise ship!). Now, I've never been on a cruise ship, and if the cabins on one are anything like these rooms, I'd rather stay at home. They are like living in a shoebox... You have to go outside to change your mind. This isn't too bad if you're only staying for one or two nights, but if you're there for a long term, it's very cramped. The restaurant in the lobby is very good, the only beef I have with them is the one piece of toast that they give with the "Voucher Breakfasts." Is it really that much more expensive to put one more slice of bread in the toaster? Oh, and they have no straws for their beverages.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great view of downtown Vancouver. Comfortable rooms, reasonably priced. Well connected by transit buses to all places in Vancouver. Well maintained, homely meals.

HotelInfo.Name: Shaughnessy Village
HotelInfo.Address: 1125 West 12th Ave, Vancouver, British Columbia V6H 3Z3, Canada
